The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about how the war film is a genre of film with a specific construction from WWI to the present. Watching old war films with intention and with literature in context allowed us as students to dive into themes and subtle undertones in these films. The introduction to a 'warrior culture' is interesting.

This course explores the concept of warrior status and warrior culture as depicted in various war films. Throughout the course, students will view and discuss war films chronologically dating from 1930 (All Quiet on the Western Front) to 2006 (Letters from Iwo Jima) alongside supplementary readings and video clips shown in class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths are the syllabus, and the films selected were great. 

Weaknesses are I think we should start talking about the films the week they're screened, when you revisit them any longer after that they details are not as fresh.

Strength: Students will gain a vast array of perspectives on warrior culture through the many films viewed. They will also develop a lens for detecting pro-war / anti-war cinematic strategies.

Weakness: At times, the assigned material exceeds what is focused on during discussion. Students may adapt the approach they take toward reading/watching the assigned material throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, fun film course on war films and warrior culture.
Yes, if you are interested in viewing films you havent before and learning from a primary source about life in the military.

extras.title: CSBF 380 01 - War Films and Warrior Culture
